revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{Article history|action1=GAN |action1date=23:53, 21 September 2011 |action1link=Talk:Battle of Pusan Perimeter/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=451764222 |currentstatus=GA |topic=war |action2=WAR |action2date=20:42, 23 January 2012 (UTC) |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Battle of Pusan Perimeter |action2result=approved |action2oldid=472100511 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history|class=A|B1=y|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y|US=yes|Korean=yes|Cold-War=yes|A-Class=pass}} {{WikiProject Korea|class=GA|importance=High|milhist=yes|nk=yes}} {{WikiProject United States|class=GA|importance=High}} {{WikiProject Cold War|class=GA|importance=High}} }} ==Confusing Army and Air Force reference== Even thought it is referenced, I find this statement very difficult to believe: "Several hundred fighter-bombers of the Fifth Air Force were positioned just off the coast aboard the USS Valley Forge and the USS Philippine Sea". The U.S. Navy's Task Force 77, commanded from the [[USS_Valley_Forge_(CV-45)|USS Valley Forge]], carried U.S. Navy air groups on each of its two carriers, not U.S. Air Force aircraft. In addition, the two carriers would have carried, at most, two hundred aircraft (100 per carrier), not "several hundred". The author of the statement may be confused by the fact that the USS Valley Forge carried [[Carrier Air Group Five|Carrier Air Wing Five]], while the U.S. Air Force aircraft in the region were under the [[Fifth Air Force]]. [[User:Darkstar8799|Darkstar8799]] ([[User talk:Darkstar8799|talk]]) 18:34, 5 July 2011 (UTC) :I've clarified this to indicate that aircraft were off the coast ''and'' aboard the carriers, since many of the USAF aircraft were in Japan. —[[User:Ed!|'''Ed!''']][[User talk:Ed!|'''(talk)''']] 15:48, 10 January 2012 (UTC) ==Yongsan references are wrong?== The references to Yongsan must be wrong, but I don't know what is the correct location (yet, at least). The only Yongsan I can find is way up by Seoul, and since this is way down south, it must refer to something else, a typo on the Army's part. [[User:wbfergus|wbfergus]] 15:07, 27 December 2006 (UTC) The changes between English and Korean are always an issue, the Yongsan referred to in the article is actually Yangsan about 40 minutes north of Pusan on the Nakdong river (the name is spelled Yangsan, Yongsan, and even Yeongsan depending on the transition and the forms that are used. [[User:Winterrider|Winterrider]] ([[User talk:Winterrider|talk]]) 13:26, 16 February 2010 (UTC) ==Image Bias== Every single one of the pictures of troops is of US forces. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/91.106.45.147|91.106.45.147]] ([[User talk:91.106.45.147|talk]]) 01:30, 29 June 2010 (UTC) :I have been looking for more sources of images, but the only ones I can use without copyright violation are those from the US Army + government sources. If you can find more images we can use for the other side, please let me know where! Thanks, —[[User:Ed!|'''Ed!''']][[User talk:Ed!|'''(talk)''']] 03:46, 29 June 2010 (UTC) ===Bias much=== It wasn't just American troops that died in the battle a lot of Korean and British soldiers also died. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Davido488|Davido488]] ([[User talk:Davido488|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Davido488|contribs]]) 22:32, 17 August 2010 (UTC) :I recently corrected this. Unfortunately it took scanning through paper clippings to find any answers. Only a small number of British troops were casualties though, comparatively. —[[User:Ed!|'''Ed!''']][[User talk:Ed!|'''(talk)''']] 03:49, 11 January 2012 (UTC) ::Official British history did not report significant combat activities for Commonwealth forces until September 20, yet by then the Pusan battle had already ended...me think someone has taken himself a tad bit too serious. [[User:Jim101|Jim101]] ([[User talk:Jim101|talk]]) 01:29, 14 January 2012 (UTC) == Map needed == May I respectfully submit that an article on the Pusan Perimeter that lacks a map of the entire peninsula (thus providing context to the area of which the article speaks), is not only doing a disservice, but ''is missing the whole frigging point''. [[Special:Contributions/98.82.84.209|98.82.84.209]] ([[User talk:98.82.84.209|talk]]) 17:50, 30 May 2012 (UTC) :Added two maps of the entire peninsula. —[[User:Ed!|'''Ed!''']][[User talk:Ed!|'''(talk)''']] 18:01, 30 May 2012 (UTC) ::Many thanks, kind Ed. [[Special:Contributions/98.82.84.209|98.82.84.209]] ([[User talk:98.82.84.209|talk]]) 23:15, 30 May 2012 (UTC)
